name: Slimes (itch) (Duck Bear)
description:
Slimes was made for the 8 Bits to  Infinity: Mouse Jam, that gave 10 days to build and complete a game from scratch with only one requirement, you can only use the mouse.

WHAT'S INSIDE?

Slimes includes two gamemode types: "Protect" and "Serve"

  • in Protect you must keep at least one good slime alive while bad slimes come from all around to eat it.
  • in Serve you must click on slimes to satisfy their hunger, keeping them alive; if their hunger reaches zero they will start to take damage, which will eventually end them.

CONTROLS

  • in Protect you can hold left mouse button over a good slime to drag them and move them around, you can also left click on bad slimes to hurt them, eventually ending them.
  • in Serve you can hold left mouse button over a slime to drag them, and you can left click any slime to feed the slime.

In both gamemodes you can press the right mouse button to spawn food for the good slimes can go to; the food does have a 20 second cooldown timer after every use, use it wisely.

GOAL?

  • in Protect your main goal should be to get your score higher and higher and keep as many slimes alive as possible.
  • in Serve your main goal should be getting a high score as well as managing your slimes.

SECRETS?!

There are two secret stages that are unlocked by playing the game and thinking a bit out of the box.
